Posts.Title: Poll - How old were you when dx with BC Times3 Minetta57
My arm still hurts kaeyreed sbmolee

Posts.Content: Feb 17, 2010 02:52PM 4lumps wrote: Raili -- I completely agree with u.  I had a Bilateral Mastectomy back in Nov 2009 and after my chemo my dr wants me to do 6 weeks of radiation.  She (Rads dr) basically told me that its going to be a walk in the park.  She assured me that I won't have damaged skin or damage to my implants (I had augmentation b4 my diagnosis and they left the implants in following BMX).  But after researching and speaking with my plastic surgeon, I'm finding out that there is a good chance that I would have to get reconstruction using a flap of skin from another part of my body to fix my breast if I do get radiation.  I feel like treating my stage 1 cancer w/chemo (AC & Taxol) followed by Herceptin and 5yrs Tamoxifen, that hopefully that would be enough.  So I'm opting out of Rads.
Posts.Title: Wanting to chicken out of radiation... lotstolivefor helena1018

Posts.Content: Nov 18, 2009 09:51PM 4lumps wrote: To All of the Ladies who replied,    Thank You soooooooo much for all of your kind and encouraging words.  I'm still trying to deal with this.  I had a good past two days (no crying) and today was another bad day.   I got my path reports back from my mastectomy.  And although they're pretty positive that they got all the cancer out, they found that I infact had 4 additional cancerous tumors that came out with the tissue.  So I had a total of 8 in one breast.   I found out that more than likely I'll have to have some form of Chemo w/Radiation, and I'm terrified of losing my hair now.  I'm African American and my hair doesn't normally grow fast.  I wish I knew what kind of Chemo I was getting, (I won't know until sometime next week) so I can research the meds, but I'll just have to wait and see.  Thanks Again for all of your caring comments.
Posts.Title: Not really understanding why I have BC 4lumps Hattie

Posts.Content: 4lumps wrote: Hello Ladies,   I was diagnosed with BC on 10/22/09.  The past month has been hell.  I've had countless iv's put in, countless blood tests, countless drs appts., and 3 surgeries (Lumpectomy, Sentinel Lymph Node Biopsy and Bilateral skin sparring mastectomy).  I am so angry about this diagnosis mainly because I don't understand why I was given it.  Although I trust my Oncologist, its still hard to accept because I have no known risk factors.  I am 31yrs old, no family hiistory, active, not overweight (5'4", 120lbs), no alcohol, non-smoker, etc...  I keep wondering was my diagnosis a mistake?  I'm sick & tired of this emotional rollercoaster I am on.  I'm trying to stay positive and I'm also trying not to let my family and friends see how much all of this is killing me inside.  They keep telling me that I am strong and I am handling this so well (if only they were a fly on my wall).  I've considered all of the appts, tests and surgeries I've dealt with in the past month to be like hurdles and honestly I'm getting tired of jumping. I'm sorry if I'm bringing anyone down with this posts, but I'm just being honest. Dx 10/22/2009, IDC, 1cm, Stage I, Grade 1, 0/6 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Not really understanding why I have BC 4lumps Hattie
